page.title: 17NATURAL HISTORY (PART 2)
page.content: The area is distinguished for the discovery in the nineteenth century by a famous botanist,Henry Doubleday,of the bardfield Oxlip.That unique and lovely flower is still to be found.But it is in the generality of the area flora that the pleasures of everyday life are found.The elms are gone.But oak,ash,maple and lime flourish as do the wild flowers that grow in profusio -n in every wood,hedge,ditch and along -side the roadside verges. Diserving special mention are the Green Hellebore,Yellow Archangel, Valerian Nettle leaved Bellflower in the ancient woodlands,& Sulphur Clover. Most loved and conspicuous is the Cowslip,a species distinct from the rarer Oxlip.Modern agricultural practices have put pressure on plant life but conservationist measures are now creating an appropriate balance.
